newsitem.title: USA: Integrated Systems to buy back shares.
newsitem.headline: Integrated Systems to buy back shares.

text.p: Integrated Systems Inc said on Wednesday it plans to repurchase up to one million shares of its common stock for cash.
The company, which has about 23 million shares outstanding, said its board of directors had authorized it to repurchase the stock at market prices and as market and business conditions warrant.

"With current market conditions, we have an opportunity to buy back our shares at what we believe are attractive levels," Naren Gupta, chairman of the Board of Directors, said in a statement. "Our current strong cash position allows us to implement this repurchase plan without adversely impacting our internal investment programs."
A portion of the repurchased shares may be used to fund employee benefit plans, Integrated Systems said. The balance will be available for general corporate purposes.
No time limit was set for the completion of the share repurchase program, the company said.
Integrated Systems develops software for the telecommunications, automotive, multimedia, entertainment, aerospace and other industries.
